description.text:

Responsible for installation, calibration, inspection, and inventory of all biomedical and related technical equipment. Also served as the biomed liaison to the US Capital and Supreme Court buildings.

1998 US Navy Bootcamp and various schools (see education).

Aaron is the definition of delivering great quality client experiences! Aaron designed and delivered a model that puts the clinicians and healthcare workers in the center and grow a model from there. Above all, Aaron knows how to collaborate with other teams and actively seeks to understand and include them in the conversation. I highly recommend Aaron for any leadership position!

updates.postText:
What an incredible experience presenting at the 2025 AAMI eXchange in New Orleans! 🌟

Our session, “Strategic Talent Acquisition: Managing Recruitment & Retention in HTM,” was a great success—thank you to everyone who joined us and contributed to the conversation.

A special shoutout to Jacob Lupo  for your invaluable collaboration and insight. Your partnership made this session even more impactful.

And of course, thank you to #AAMI for the opportunity to speak at such a premier event for health technology professionals. It’s always an honor to connect with and learn from the brilliant minds shaping the future of HTM.

Until next time! 👏
#AAMIeXchange #HTM #HealthcareTechnology #TalentAcquisition #WorkforceDevelopment #Collaboration #RecruitmentInnovation

linkedin_data.name: Steve Howell, CFA, CMA, CPA
linkedin_data.headline: VP Treasurer (Interim)
linkedin_data.summary:
With 30+ years of high-level leadership experience in complex roles requiring exceptional project coordination, budgeting strategies, and management skills, I carry a wealth of business development tools for operational and financial leadership. With my skills in strategy development and process optimization, teams under my direction have accomplished top-level organizational objectives while cultivating positive workplace environments through talent management, lean methodologies, and interdepartmental communication structures. I have achieved millions in savings through process redesign, outsourcing, eliminating redundancies, and leading data-driven organizational improvement initiatives. I am also a strong communicator skilled at liaising with executive management teams and the Board of Directors to champion effective leadership practices at all levels.

A selection of my key accomplishments includes:
● I achieved $5 million in annual savings by outsourcing in-house anesthesia, emergency department, and hospitalist physicians.
● I collaborated in an ongoing effort to improve employed provider productivity levels from 25th to 50th MGMA percentiles by assessing, recommending, and integrating employed physician compensation models.
● I centralized all the banking and investment management relationships and reduced annual costs by over $1.2 million.
● In conjunction with external financial experts, I coordinated a $250 million bond issue to conduct due diligence, determine bond size, and develop a Single Obligated Group for a Master Trust Indenture. 
● I guided a team of internal analysts, outside attorneys, expert witnesses, and investment bankers to pursue damages from System’s previous management company, leading to a settlement of over $50 million.
● I avoided millions of dollars in interest costs by implementing $205M low-rate FHA 242 debt financing to expand a suburban hospital.

To learn more about my skills and qualifications, connect with me on LinkedIn.

experience.title: CFO Ochsner Baton Rouge/Lake Charles Region

description.text:
Howell Analytics, LLC was established in 2010 to serve two markets. First, healthcare industry clients of any size in need of specialized analyses and project coordination. Second, small and mid-sized companies (< $50 million sales) desiring value-added, sophisticated analytical services at affordable prices.  Howell Analytics also assists start-up companies complete the business planning and feasibility analyses they will need to become viable.  

Services provided include, but is not necessarily limited, to the following:

-Interim Executive Management
-Business Valuations
-Feasibility and Sustainability Plans
-Strategic Assessments & Plans
-Environmental Scans
-Business Plans
-Product Line evaluation and planning
-Cost Accounting system design
-Joint Venture evaluation, support and coordination
-Impact analyses
-Contract review assistance
-RFP construction, evaluation and management (if required)
-Legislative impact analysis

Howell Analytics typically works on an hourly basis, but will also price some services on a prospective basis. Hourly rates vary depending both upon the level of complexity and the size of each project.

I direct executive-level leadership for a $1.7 billion system supporting nine hospitals and 700+ employed providers and manage all financial and treasury functions as well as strategic projects, process improvement, and change management. 

My areas of focus are as follows:
Strategic Leadership
● Identified and implemented optimized financial structures to restructure critical access hospitals for improved performance. 
● Collaborated on vendor selection process to assess long-term ownership costs of new EMR system.
● Co-directed team to evaluate and improve underperforming retail system for pharmacy operations while securing 340B Drug Discount Program benefits.
● Developed five-year integrated strategic financial planning process to coordinate optimal operating performance with required system capital.
● Directed comprehensive evaluation and acquisition of MRI center.
Operational Leadership
● Led complex system analysis and optimization project to maximize tertiary hospital utilization and eliminate redundancy for specialist physician requirements. 
● Increased efficiency by reducing excess days at tertiary hospitals. 
Relationship Building – Board of Directors 
● Served as primary liaison between executive management team and Board of Directors in regular Investment Subcommittee meetings, including presenting investment results, coordinating periodic review of system Investment Policy Statement, and leading ad-hoc and cyclical analyses of Defined Benefit and Define Contribution pension plans.
● Acted as liaison with critical access hospital sub-boards to create develop financial strategies and restructuring plans to benefit the hospital systems and local communities. 
Financial Leadership
● Led Accounts Payable department to increase payment cycle times, reducing working capital requirements and increasing Days Cash on Hand.
● Eliminated redundancy to save costs, including reducing investment advisors from 10 to one and saving more than $500 thousand in fees.

section_components.caption: April 13, 2012, Will managed Steve directly
section_components.subtitle: Partner at Eide Bailly, LLP

fixedListComponent.text: I've known Steve for over twenty years, both in a supervisory role and, today, in a consultant-to-consultant relationship.  Anyone looking for an industry resource for project specific services will find him a great investment with immediate, high impact payback.  Steve functions well in a team environment and has strong expertise merging financial and operational skills honed through years of strong experience allowing him to add value to any situation. His strong work ethic accomplishes the typical project ahead of schedule. Analytically, he's a brilliant talent capable of learning independently on the fly.  This quality is an extraordinarily rare advantage for a consultant in our industry, which is constantly evolving as numerous sub-fields interact. Steve rolls up his sleeves everyday and learns the latest techniques and industry rules, but I judge his strongest talent as his ability to picture an analysis and its variables in his mind before numerically painting them in exquisite, understandable detail.  Over and over again I have seen him create new financial models complex enough to take all essential variables into place, but simple to understand and use in effectively communicating with various constituents.  Several examples will suffice.  During our time working together for an IDS ("Integrated Delivery System") in the early to mid-1990's, Steve successfully developed complex financial models for all of the System's entities that spanned the continuum from physician clinics, reference laboratories and nursing homes, to HMOs and acute care hospitals. He demonstrated an ability to learn the specific characteristics of each of the healthcare entities' sub-market segments on the run and on an independent basis. He successfully built models that incorporated data from our different companies so simultaneous projections could effectively be made.  For a time, we owned both an HMO and several acute care hospitals.  Steve built a model to show the overall impact of patient volume to the "System" as well as each company individually by effectively accounting for the incidence of "inter-company" profits. This led us to powerful insights in negotiating with "ourselves" and determining HMO rates for our hospitals. Another example of Steve's formidable skill was the development of a comprehensive financial modeling of a Long Term Acute Care space rental within our Baton Rouge facility in the early 1990's, complete with ancillary revenue impacts and related overhead costing on both a marginal and fully loaded basis.  His analytic skill sets in healthcare are as powerful in relation to physician alignment and group practice management evaluations as to primary and tertiary acute care development.  Steve is an invaluable resource my current firm turns to often for our most complex projects, particularly with regard to due diligence efforts involving a need for both rigorous analytics and a thorough understanding of strategic financial planning.

section_components.caption: January 13, 2012, Kim worked with Steve but on different teams
section_components.subtitle: Chief Executive Officer at Louisiana Women's Healthcare

fixedListComponent.text: Steve is a brilliant financial, operational and strategic resource.  Have been professionally connected to Steve Howell for years - he has been a relied upon, value-added, resource by senior executives and governing bodies for very credible decision support and guidance in many significant matters affecting enterprise-wide results.  Strong successful trackrecord of developing and managing cost accounting systems and cash forecasting models among other financial decsion support systems.  Experienced in financial feasibility studies and strategic business planning initiatives.

section_components.caption: October 25, 2011, Steve worked with Cindy but they were at different companies
section_components.subtitle: Chief Executive Officer at Louisiana Health Care Quality Forum

fixedListComponent.text: I have worked with Cindy as a colleague in a large acute care hospital and as a consultant for her in her new role of leading Louisiana's largest HIE.  Cindy's greatest strength is managing groups of people with a spectrum of skill sets in order to plan, complete and operate complex processes. She has demonstrated this skill, for example, by successfully planning for hurricanes in one of her former roles to having an HIE system stood-up and operational by a defined deadline in her new one. She has been successful in managing these groups as a result of her talent for choosing the right people to work for her or to bring in as consultants so that a cohesive team has formed once the project starts. She leads by example and has a fast learning curve meaning that she is able to learn enough new trend in relevant technical fields to provide required project guidance. The Louisiana Healthcare Quality Forum is lucky to have Cindy at the helm. I would readily endorse Cindy for any type of management position where creating and leading multi-sklled teams were the key to success.

section_components.caption: October 25, 2011, Steve worked with Brenda but they were at different companies
section_components.subtitle: Senior Manager at DaVita Kidney Care

fixedListComponent.text: I've worked with Brenda over the last six months where I have assisted her evaluate the financial implications of different strategic directions while she has led an effort to create a state sponsored HIE.  Her job is a demanding one as she has been under a tremendous amount of pressure from both numerous deadlines as well as this industry segment's "new" status which provides few examples of what works. Despite this she has been able to successfully coordinate the technical and financial aspects of this project and remain on schedule. I would strongly recommend Brenda for any type of senior level IT project management role. She has the necessary technical skills, but also shows a strong aptitude for the business/finance side of things.

fixedListComponent.text: I've worked with Brenda over the last six months where I have assisted her evaluate the financial implications of different strategic directions while she has led an effort to create a state sponsored HIE. Despite this she has been able to successfully coordinate the technical and financial aspects of this project and remain on schedule. I would strongly recommend Brenda for any type of senior level IT project management role. She has the necessary technical skills, but also shows a strong aptitude for the business/finance side of things.

experience.title: Chief Financial Officer, Sentara Norfolk General Hospital

description.text:
Provide leadership for Level 1 Trauma Center and flagship Sentara Health hospital, in addition to system-wide pharmacy, residencies, and lab, with a focus on developing financial bench strength for future leaders across the hospital. 
♦	Collaborate as a business partner for hospital administrators and Corporate VPs on strategic and operational planning, revenue and cost optimization, and corporate driven initiatives. 
♦	Serve as an essential member of the hospital's President’s Council and Senior Leadership Team to provide management input with the goal to improve performance of Sentara within the hospital and system.

experience.title: Vice President of Medical Group Finance

description.text: Oversaw planning, coordination, and direction of financial activities for Valley Health Medical Group with a focus on supporting successful attainment of operational and strategic objectives. Lead development and execution of controls within a highly sophisticated regulatory and healthcare revenue cycle environment in addition to physician compensation.

Served as Director of Finance for three hospitals and a multispecialty physician group. Directed activities related to annual financial cycle for the region; oversaw budget, routine and strategic capital management, long range financial planning, and financial and productivity analysis. Led development of business plans and proposals to establish new clinical services; skilled in evaluating staffing needs with a focus on maximizing regional revenue opportunities. 

Developed physician compensation plans; coordinated submissions to benchmarking organizations and advised on compensation philosophy. Developed system-wide strategy and implementation plan designed to address referral leakage. 

Drove innovation by developing a multi-year workforce and succession plan for provider recruitment. Generated stability by creating and piloting system-wide dashboards for incident command and provider COVID-19 reassignments. Led development of system-wide strategies designed to create a unified provider compensation philosophy across four physician groups at 4K providers and address physician fee schedule changes.

Directed the division of Financial Services, including Business Services, Financial Analysis and Budget, and Financial Accounting and Reporting. Managed the relationship between the IUSM and the IU Foundation endowment. Provided vital structure by designing and directing production of complex financial and operational reports for internal and external stakeholders; developed standard metrics and reports in Tableau to support accreditation and enterprise funds flow operations. 

Oversaw strategic use of operational funds.; advised CFO on opportunities to advance cash strategy by maximizing use of restricted resources; established long-range financial plans for funding capital projects and long-term commitments. Directed all of IU Medical Group Foundation operations, including daily operations, investment management, board meetings, and annual audit.

fixedListComponent.text:
I am honored to stumble across this opportunity to share insight on Alexandra - a professional that I truly admire. Alex brings a unique perspective to every conversation- business or casual - while also generously providing space to other opinions, insights, and conclusions. 

This skill cannot be taught and is very valuable when working in the scientific fields. Alex is one of the few people I’ve met that is capable of empirically investigating a problem while offering collaboration as a solution.

section_components.caption: June 24, 2025, Amanda was senior to Sally but didn't manage Sally directly
section_components.subtitle: Director, Patient Accounting @ Sentara Health | CRCR, CHFP

fixedListComponent.text:
I became close with Sally at Sentara because I saw what she could do for my hospital (selfishly) but also because I saw what a great colleague she is. From the first Teams Meeting, I immediately recognized how engaged and connected to the mission Sally was - but more importantly, the role she played in it. 

The most important thing I do as a CFO is ensure I can be paid for the hard work my team performs caring for for nation’s population. This is important to my relationship with my doctors, nurses, interprofessional health team and my leaders. 

Sally is the ideal partner in this work. She’s here to play - to actively drive success. Curiosity and drive cannot be taught and she has it in spades.

updates.postText:
Who do you think of when you envision your future work-self? I would love to help you become that person! Posting a role for a new team member at MedStar Washington Hospital Center is creating nostalgia for the best-in-class colleagues that I've had the luck to recruit first in my prior roles - there's always something special about your first! (Yes, Brandon Mathis - I'm talking about you!) 

The Senior Finance Business Partner with the MWHC team will gain experience at an academic medical center and Level 1 Trauma center - a fertile ground for curious minds and ambitious learners. MedStar is the largest health system in the DMV area, in addition to being truly committed to community programs based on research on social determinants of health. I cannot wait to get in deeper and find all of the treasures that MedStar has to teach me - would you like to join? See link below to get started!

experience.title: Regional Business Director of Business Operations - Perioperative Services

description.text:
I serve as the Regional Director of Business Operations for Perioperative Services at MedStar Health’s Baltimore Region, I oversee the financial and operational strategies for four hospitals and the scheduling operations for MedStar Montgomery Medical Center. I lead the development and implementation of operational budgets, capital plans, and revenue strategies to achieve organizational goals while collaborating with hospital executives and perioperative leaders to enhance cost center performance and resource allocation. My role includes standardizing OR scheduling and block utilization reporting processes to improve efficiency, generating actionable insights through advanced financial reports, and driving cost savings initiatives in collaboration with supply chain teams and vendors.

As a results-oriented leader, I streamline operational processes, ensure compliance with regulatory standards, and foster collaboration across multidisciplinary teams to deliver optimal patient outcomes. I am committed to developing high-performing teams by mentoring staff, fostering professional growth, and conducting regular performance reviews. By combining data-driven decision-making with a strategic focus on continuous improvement, I work to align regional initiatives with broader organizational objectives, ensuring excellence in Perioperative Services operations.

experience.title: Business Director of Perioperative Services
experience.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States · On-site

description.text:
•	Develop, implement, and manage business operations that oversee all fiscal activities related to Perioperative Services.
•	Responsible for strategy and implementation of the operational budgets, capital review, asset management, revenue planning, and overall performance
•	Provide direction over the financial performance of Perioperative Services to include but not limited to interpreting and monitoring the annual supply budgets, including identification of cost-effective alternatives, product evaluation, product standardization, and contractual agreements
•	Work collaboratively with System Supply Chain, local Perioperative Leaders, physicians, and vendors on Value Analysis Committee requests
•	Coordinate contract negotiations and represent MWHC in external surgical management-related organizations and functions
•	Monitors volumes, collections, income, and expenses on a monthly basis and makes recommendations to enhance revenue and financial outcomes
•	Interpret/evaluate block utilization and make recommendations for improvement as needed
•	Serve as administrative liaison to Perioperative Governance Committee Block Subcommittee and external groups, including faculty
•	Monitor and provide recommendations for improving provider performance, specifically with quality, safety, patient experience, documentation, and other compliance measures
•	Directs and manages leaders and staff of the surgical billing, surgical auditing, and surgical posting to include but not limited to interviewing and hiring, supervising, orienting, training, scheduling, coaching, counseling and evaluating, promoting and terminating employees

•	Champion management decision making and resource allocation processes by maintaining and reporting accurate inpatient and outpatient statistics for UF Health organization
•	Leverage business acumen with extensive knowledge in data analysis and data abstraction to move organization goals forward with intentional forecasting, ultimately leading to positive impact on patient care and experience 
•	Collaborate with University of Florida and UF Health leadership to forecast budget and patient volume projections
•	Lead data accuracy assurance through supervision of budget specialist and budget assistant, overseeing monthly reports and physician budget meetings
•	Conduct annual interviews with 40+ chiefs and chairs for College of Medicine divisions that budget patient volume

Key Highlights
•	Create annual patient volume budget projections for UF Health and provide ownership over annual submission of patient volume data for AHCA, COTH, and Self-Insurance reports for UF Health
•	Facilitate inpatient and outpatient statistical reports a quarter; identifying trends and providing recommendations for budgets adjustments and intentional financial planning based on data impact
•	Advance standardization of current statistical reporting processes with multi-disciplinary teams, improving patient charge capture and data reporting efficiency
•	Partner with Finance Director on special projects for UF Health and UF College of Medicine executive leadership

experience.title: Assistant Risk Manager and Quality Improvement Analyst

description.text:
• Directed Quality Improvement Committees, monitoring client quality of care, staff concerns, client concerns, employee wellness, and overall organizational compliance
• Investigated and resolved client concerns and facility sentinel events for all Meridian locations in 10 surrounding counties
• Assist Director of Business Information with monthly reporting for committees and leadership council groups
• Worked with Chief Operating Officer, Risk Manager, and VP of Decision Support in conducting root cause investigation for adverse events

Under the President of MMG's leadership, overseeing a budget of up to $2B and 10 direct reports steering strategic growth initiatives and ensuring operational excellence across a multi-specialty medical group.

▪Directed MMG's executive leadership team, strategically governing a diverse portfolio of over 38 specialties across 300+ care sites, elevating operational efficiency and financial performance for multiple pillars of healthcare service delivery. 
▪Executed a tactical business plan to establish a flagship multi-specialty Medical Office facility, consolidating operations, introducing new service lines, and securing a multi-year lease on schedule and under budget constraints.
▪Partnered with the President of MedStar Ambulatory Services to enhance multi-specialty and ambulatory surgery center operations, fostering efficient care delivery and patient-centric services.
▪Headed the reorg, scalability, and optimization of the patient call center operations centralizing under a unified infrastructure; deployed a system-wide service line approach to patient access, yielding a 5% baseline improvement, 7-fig net revenue, and value performance gain.

𝘜𝘜𝘎 𝘪𝘴 𝘢 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘦𝘳 𝘰𝘧 𝘶𝘳𝘰𝘭𝘰𝘨𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘭 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦, 𝘰𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘳𝘦𝘩𝘦𝘯𝘴𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘨𝘩 𝘢 𝘯𝘦𝘵𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘰𝘧 𝘤𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘤𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘮𝘣𝘶𝘭𝘢𝘵𝘰𝘳𝘺 𝘴𝘶𝘳𝘨𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘭 𝘤𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘴.

In partnership with the Board, CEO, and physician leadership, managed a  $350M revenue portfolio and 10 senior executives leading the strategic development and implementation of financial and operational objectives across 4 states, 52 clinics, and 20 Ambulatory Centers.

▪Steered the acquisition and integration of three independent urology group practices, merging IT, HRIS, and Patient Contact Center systems, yielding a 5% net rate increase and expansion of national presence.
▪Developed and implemented a comprehensive operational plan, accelerating growth initiatives, market expansion, and practice integration processes, establishing UUG as the leading consolidated urology practice in the US.
▪Oversaw EBITDA value creation, driving profitability through clinical service line expansions, operational scalability enhancements, targeted marketing,  and sales campaigns; created significant revenue growth and margin improvement.
▪Facilitated seamless integration across multiple states, synchronizing clinical/IT systems, optimizing MSO functions, and implementing value-added clinical programs, fostering operational synergy and efficiency.
▪Established an innovative national management model featuring market-based COOs, Physician Executive Councils, and governance structures for ancillary services, facilitating strategic alignment and effective leadership within diverse markets.

𝘌𝘯𝘷𝘪𝘴𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘪𝘴 𝘢 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘦𝘳 𝘰𝘧 𝘱𝘩𝘺𝘴𝘪𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘯-𝘭𝘦𝘥 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴, 𝘥𝘦𝘭𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘦𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘢𝘯𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘴𝘪𝘢, 𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘨𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘺 𝘮𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘤𝘪𝘯𝘦, 𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘰𝘭𝘰𝘨𝘺, & 𝘴𝘶𝘳𝘨𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘸𝘪𝘥𝘦.

Reported to the President, overseeing a $500M budget and 5 Regional Vice Presidents, responsible for leadership, development, growth, strategic planning, operations management, and fiscal performance. 

▪Transformed Envision Healthcare's Radiology Division from regional to the premier hospital-based practice in the US; achieved over $500M in revenue and expanded market share from <1% to 5% through strategic growth and M&A transactions.
▪Governed the successful acquisition of a national radiology company, leveraging an advanced technology platform to scale operations and diversify revenue streams; integrated a teleradiology capability to enhance service offerings.
▪Partnered with IT leadership to develop and execute a comprehensive technology roadmap; implemented an innovative "distributed" radiology service model, setting new standards for excellence in the market.
▪Cultivated and nurtured high-level relationships with strategic JV and health system partners, fostering collaboration and ensuring alignment with organizational objectives, leading to enhanced market presence.
▪Strategically allocated and leveraged resources to support a team of over 800 radiologists, optimizing operational efficiency and driving performance excellence across the service line.
▪Assembled a top-tier national management team selecting and developing key talent to effectively navigate the complexities of service line operations, driving strategic growth and operational success.

description.text:
𝘔𝘦𝘥𝘚𝘵𝘢𝘳 𝘪𝘴 𝘢𝘯 𝘕𝘍𝘗 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘭𝘵𝘩𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘰𝘳𝘨𝘢𝘯𝘪𝘻𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘰𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘴 𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘳 300 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘭𝘵𝘩𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘦𝘴, 𝘪𝘯𝘤𝘭𝘶𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 10 𝘩𝘰𝘴𝘱𝘪𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘴 𝘢𝘤𝘳𝘰𝘴𝘴 𝘉𝘢𝘭𝘵𝘪𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘞𝘢𝘴𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨𝘵𝘰𝘯.

Under the President of MMG's leadership, overseeing a budget of up to $2B and 10 direct reports steering strategic growth initiatives and ensuring operational excellence across a multi-specialty medical group.

▪Directed MMG's executive leadership team, strategically governing a diverse portfolio of over 38 specialties across 300+ care sites, elevating operational efficiency and financial performance for multiple pillars of healthcare service delivery. 
▪Executed a tactical business plan to establish a flagship multi-specialty Medical Office facility, consolidating operations, introducing new service lines, and securing a multi-year lease on schedule and under budget constraints.
▪Partnered with the President of MedStar Ambulatory Services to enhance multi-specialty and ambulatory surgery center operations, fostering efficient care delivery and patient-centric services.
▪Headed the reorg, scalability, and optimization of the patient call center operations centralizing under a unified infrastructure; deployed a system-wide service line approach to patient access, yielding a 5% baseline improvement, 7-fig net revenue, and value performance gain.

Reported to the President of MMG, serving as the inaugural COO, oversaw a budget of $750M, leading the Strategy and Business Development Division. 

▪Directed a team of 4 (including VPs) across Primary Care and Hospital-based Service Pillars.  
▪Drove operational efficiency and financial performance as MMG's Executive P&L lead, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives to achieve sustainable growth and profitability.
▪Spearheaded MMG's Access Center Consolidation Strategy, optimizing operations and incorporating service lines across four large contact centers, enhancing patient access and experience.
▪Presided over practice-related real estate assets throughout MedStar Health's system footprint, augmenting resource allocation and supporting strategic initiatives.

𝘜𝘜𝘎 𝘪𝘴 𝘢 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘦𝘳 𝘰𝘧 𝘶𝘳𝘰𝘭𝘰𝘨𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘭 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦, 𝘰𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘳𝘦𝘩𝘦𝘯𝘴𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘨𝘩 𝘢 𝘯𝘦𝘵𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘰𝘧 𝘤𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘤𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘮𝘣𝘶𝘭𝘢𝘵𝘰𝘳𝘺 𝘴𝘶𝘳𝘨𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘭 𝘤𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘴.

In partnership with the Board, CEO, and physician leadership, managed a  $350M revenue portfolio and 10 senior executives leading the strategic development and implementation of financial and operational objectives across 4 states, 52 clinics, and 20 Ambulatory Centers.

▪Steered the acquisition and integration of three independent urology group practices, merging IT, HRIS, and Patient Contact Center systems, yielding a 5% net rate increase and expansion of national presence.
▪Developed and implemented a comprehensive operational plan, accelerating growth initiatives, market expansion, and practice integration processes, establishing UUG as the leading consolidated urology practice in the US.
▪Oversaw EBITDA value creation, driving profitability through clinical service line expansions, operational scalability enhancements, targeted marketing,  and sales campaigns; created significant revenue growth and margin improvement.
▪Facilitated seamless integration across multiple states, synchronizing clinical/IT systems, optimizing MSO functions, and implementing value-added clinical programs, fostering operational synergy and efficiency.
▪Established an innovative national management model featuring market-based COOs, Physician Executive Councils, and governance structures for ancillary services, facilitating strategic alignment and effective leadership within diverse markets.

𝘌𝘯𝘷𝘪𝘴𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘪𝘴 𝘢 𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘦𝘳 𝘰𝘧 𝘱𝘩𝘺𝘴𝘪𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘯-𝘭𝘦𝘥 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘦𝘴, 𝘥𝘦𝘭𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘦𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘢𝘯𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘴𝘪𝘢, 𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘨𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘺 𝘮𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘤𝘪𝘯𝘦, 𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘰𝘭𝘰𝘨𝘺, & 𝘴𝘶𝘳𝘨𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘸𝘪𝘥𝘦.

Reported to the President, overseeing a $500M budget and 5 Regional Vice Presidents, responsible for leadership, development, growth, strategic planning, operations management, and fiscal performance. 

▪Transformed Envision Healthcare's Radiology Division from regional to the premier hospital-based practice in the US; achieved over $500M in revenue and expanded market share from <1% to 5% through strategic growth and M&A transactions.
▪Governed the successful acquisition of a national radiology company, leveraging an advanced technology platform to scale operations and diversify revenue streams; integrated a teleradiology capability to enhance service offerings.
▪Partnered with IT leadership to develop and execute a comprehensive technology roadmap; implemented an innovative "distributed" radiology service model, setting new standards for excellence in the market.
▪Cultivated and nurtured high-level relationships with strategic JV and health system partners, fostering collaboration and ensuring alignment with organizational objectives, leading to enhanced market presence.
▪Strategically allocated and leveraged resources to support a team of over 800 radiologists, optimizing operational efficiency and driving performance excellence across the service line.
▪Assembled a top-tier national management team selecting and developing key talent to effectively navigate the complexities of service line operations, driving strategic growth and operational success.

𝘌𝘢𝘨𝘭𝘦 𝘛𝘦𝘭𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘤𝘪𝘯𝘦 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘰𝘯𝘦 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘧𝘪𝘳𝘴𝘵 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘢𝘯𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘵𝘰 𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘨𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘵𝘦𝘭𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘤𝘪𝘯𝘦 𝘱𝘩𝘺𝘴𝘪𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘯 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘯𝘢 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘦𝘭𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘤𝘪𝘯𝘦 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘮𝘴 𝘵𝘰 𝘢𝘤𝘶𝘵𝘦 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘩𝘰𝘴𝘱𝘪𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘴, 𝘮𝘪𝘤𝘳𝘰𝘩𝘰𝘴𝘱𝘪𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘭𝘰𝘯𝘨-𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘮 𝘢𝘤𝘶𝘵𝘦 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘩𝘰𝘴𝘱𝘪𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘴 (𝘓𝘛𝘈𝘊𝘏𝘴).
